intro: Lindernia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Lindernia tridentata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
